ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] In response to the Plea for help
ygData.msgSnippet: In the defence of the game,  Ben Stien was responsible for his son playing this game in the first place.  In the opening game sequence in agreeing to the
ygData.messageBody:
In the defence of the game, Ben Stien was responsible
for his son playing this game in the first place. In
the opening game sequence in agreeing to the contract,
a person must be of lawful age or have the consent of
a parent or legal guardian. Unless of course, his
father didn't know, then his son was pursuing illegal
activities.

And, about his solution. Sending his son to boarding
school.... LMAO don't take the kid away from video
games, take video games away from the kid. I mean
SERIOUSLY. Any child that would not abide by the
house rules isn't too well raised anyway.. he says he
heard his son playing in the middle of the night... he
shoulda picked his kid up by the collar and beat the
ever lovin %^*$ out of him.... I gaurantee, he would
reconsider breaking the rules if he knew there would
be consiquences... obviously this kid had more
problems thanm just video games...

Don't even get me started about the suicidal punk on
48 hours either...... I hate to sound cold and
lacking in compassion, but quite frankly she asked for
the view of the players, she undoubtedly SAW 48 hours
in the first place, and it was most likely what
provoked the choice of senior thesis.

Peace out,
Marshun PsyKo


--- bullions27 <no_reply@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
> >
>
http://everquest.allakhazam.com/news/sdetail1142.html?story=1142
> >
> > In my experience, anyone who would be so afflicted
> by
> > the outcome of a game is not a terribly stable
> person
> > in the first place. Everquest has actually helped
> me
> > save money for tuition, and has kept me out of
> trouble
> > as well. I sit at home and play EverQuest for a
> few
> > hours every night. With a starting cost of 9.95
> for
> > the game, 12.95 a month for a pre-paid card (I
> hate
> > credit cards), I get the first month free, 19.99 a
> > month in internet services (which I would have
> anyway)
>
>
> Everquest is a subliminal addiction, just like
> certain people setting
> all things aside for football... on a much lesser
> scale of course
> because quite frank, there is absolutely no
> redeeming value of
> dedicating one's entire time and achieving something
> in a video game
> besides personal satisfaction (unless it's some
> godawful tournament
> which I can't ****ing stand). It all depends on the
> individual.
> Certain people can set rigid guidelines for
> themselves (play for a
> certain number of hours) and abide by them, and some
> people can't.
>
> Here's another link:
>
> http://www.etonline.com/television/a12770.htm
>
> Digital
